channel.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
channel.description: im trying to add a webclient i turned html on but i dont see an option for html.

item.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
item.dc:creator: @Nicksworld Nicksworld
item.description:
@Nicksworld wrote:

I know it’d be cheaper for me but it makes it less of a stress i’ve with smf had the same problem with the stupid ass html for a webclient i couldn’t find the option to use html in a post…

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion

item.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Why would you pay someone? lol.

You can find thousands of free images and useful snippets of code online and after taking a look at the html and css docs for a few days you could easily make sense of them and piece something together. It would save a tonne of money, especially if you were paying someone who knew what they were doing.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion

item.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
item.dc:creator: @Nicksworld Nicksworld
item.description:
@Nicksworld wrote:

All this is true but for something im setting up as a starting website it doesn’t matter because once i see i have 10 active players im paying someone to make a legit website

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion

item.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Why? There’s limited customisation, you have troubles with creating simple things as a webclient page, you have 100% control of your forums in your custom domain. The list continue on and on. If forumotion was the better option you’d see everyone using it ;).

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion

item.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
item.dc:creator: @Nicksworld Nicksworld
item.description:
@Nicksworld wrote:

why it’s the simplest and it offers plenty of free features i’ve tryed using smf and hated it because of filezilla

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion

item.title: Does anyone know to use html on forumotion
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I wouldn’t use forumotion in the first place.

You’d be better of with a free webhost and a .tk domain or something along those lines. If you go to http://www.crazydomains.co.uk you can buy a .com domain for £1, which is insanely cheap.

Read full topic
